name: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione
Reason: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione has a melting point influenced by the functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5.5°C. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The dione functional group introduces a carbonyl group, which raises the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dione interactions, estimated at around +10°C.
